bib.title: Sentinel-2 images to assess soil surface characteristics over a rainfed Mediterranean cropping system
bib.author: Cécile Gomez and Maman Sani Aboubacar and Dino Ienco and Denis Feurer and Zakia Jenhaoui and Attia Rafla and Maguelonne Teisseire and Jean-Stéphane Bailly
bib.abstract: Soil surface characteristics (SSCs) are of high importance for water infiltration processes in crop fields. As SSCs present strong spatiotemporal variability influenced by climatic conditions and agricultural practices, their monitor has already been explored by using UAV images and multispectral remote sensing. However, each technique has encountered difficulties characterizing this spatiotemporal variability. The objective of this work was to explore the potential of Sentinel-2 images to assess three SSCs – the green vegetation fraction, dry vegetation fraction and physical soil surface structure – at several dates. This work explored two approaches for classifying these three SSCs from five Sentinel-2 images acquired from August to November 2016.
